summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from September 2021 regarding a discovery request for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The request seeks contact information for FBI Victim Specialists and the victims/witnesses/attorneys they communicated with, to be provided to the U.S. Attorney's Office. It highlights the procedural steps taken to gather evidence for the upcoming trial.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Named as the subject of the investigation (50D-NY-3027571) alongside Ghislaine Maxwell, with a trial scheduled for November 2021.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as the co-subject of the investigation (50D-NY-3027571) with Jeffrey Epstein, with a trial scheduled for November 2021.

persons.name: M.S.
persons.context: An FBI Victim Specialist from the Miami Division who responds to the discovery request, stating they do not have any relevant communications.

connections.description: Named together as the subjects of the New York investigation (50D-NY-3027571) which is scheduled for trial.

events.title: Scheduled Trial for Epstein/Maxwell Investigation
events.description: The New York investigation of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell (case 50D-NY-3027571) is scheduled to begin trial.

events.title: Discovery Request Deadline
events.description: The FBI Program Manager sets a deadline of close of business for Victim Specialists to provide contact information for victims, witnesses, and attorneys for discovery purposes in the Epstein/Maxwell case.

locations: FBI Miami Division, 2030 SW 145th Avenue, Miramar, FL 33027
keyFacts: The FBI was actively gathering discovery materials for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial as of September 2021, with a trial date set for November 29, 2021.

The discovery request sought all communications (texts, emails, voicemails) between FBI Victim Specialists and any victims, witnesses, or their attorneys involved in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.
The request required Victim Specialists to provide their own contact details and the contact details of the victims/witnesses/attorneys they communicated with.
The document indicates internal FBI coordination between the Victim Services Division and field offices (like Miami) to comply with legal discovery obligations.
The email chain includes a confidentiality notice emphasizing the protected nature of the communications and the prohibition against unauthorized disclosure.
